page.title: 01Deal & Walmer: Introduction
page.content: {Deal}is located approximately 8 miles from{Dover}on the east{Kent}coast. It {was}one of the four most prosperous ports in the country. A vast sandbank, known as the{Goodwin Sands,}lie 4 miles offshore from Deal. The stretch of water between the shore and the Goodwins is known as the{Downs.}From early times{sailing ships}have sheltered there. The{Royal Marines}have been associated with Deal since 1664. Deal is now a quiet, pleasant{seaside town.}It is famous for{sea angling}from the pier, small boats and the beach. Each Autumn there are fishing festivals and competitions. There is a{Conservation {Area}with fisherman's cottages and{ {smugglers'}hiding places. There is a thriving{Rowing Club.}The largest local employers are the{National Coal {Board}and those at{Dover Harbour.
